intro: Sibiraea altaiensis var. croatica, commonly known as the Altai Siberian tea, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its small, white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant produces small, oval berries that are typically red or black when mature. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
